Docs.param: The ID of the resource.
The name of the resource.
The type of the resource.
The ETag of the resource, used for concurrency statements.
The display name for the pool.
The last modified time of the pool.
The creation time of the pool.
The current state of the pool.
The time at which the pool entered its current state.
Whether the pool is resizing.
The time at which the pool entered its current allocation state.
The size of virtual machines in the pool. All VMs in a pool are the same size.
This property describes how the pool nodes will be deployed - using Cloud Services or Virtual Machines.
The number of dedicated compute nodes currently in the pool.
The number of Spot/low-priority compute nodes currently in the pool.
Settings which configure the number of nodes in the pool.
The results and errors from the last execution of the autoscale formula.
Whether the pool permits direct communication between nodes.
The network configuration for the pool.
The number of task slots that can be used to run concurrent tasks on a single compute node in the pool.
How tasks are distributed across compute nodes in a pool.
The list of user accounts to be created on each node in the pool.
A list of name-value pairs associated with the pool as metadata.
A task specified to run on each compute node as it joins the pool.
The list of certificates to be installed on each compute node in the pool.
The list of application packages to be installed on each compute node in the pool.
The list of application licenses the Batch service will make available on each compute node in the pool.
Contains details about the current or last completed resize operation.
A list of file systems to mount on each node in the pool.
The desired node communication mode for the pool.
The current state of the pool communication mode.
The type of identity used for the Batch Pool.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Pool class.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AllocationState As Nullable(Of AllocationState)

Docs.summary: Gets whether the pool is resizing.
Docs.remarks: Possible values include: 'Steady', 'Resizing', 'Stopping'

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AllocationStateTransitionTime As Nullable(Of DateTime)

Docs.summary: Gets the time at which the pool entered its current allocation state.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property ApplicationLicenses As IList(Of String)
member this.ApplicationLicenses : System.Collections.Generic.IList<string> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the list of application licenses the Batch service will make available on each compute node in the pool.
Docs.remarks: The list of application licenses must be a subset of available Batch service application licenses. If a license is requested which is not supported, pool creation will fail.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property ApplicationPackages As IList(Of ApplicationPackageReference)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the list of application packages to be installed on each compute node in the pool.
Docs.remarks: Changes to application package references affect all new compute nodes joining the pool, but do not affect compute nodes that are already in the pool until they are rebooted or reimaged. There is a maximum of 10 application package references on any given pool.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AutoScaleRun As AutoScaleRun

Docs.summary: Gets the results and errors from the last execution of the autoscale formula.
Docs.remarks: This property is set only if the pool automatically scales, i.e. autoScaleSettings are used.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property Certificates As IList(Of CertificateReference)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the list of certificates to be installed on each compute node in the pool.
Docs.remarks:
For Windows compute nodes, the Batch service installs the certificates to the specified certificate store and location. For Linux compute nodes, the certificates are stored in a directory inside the task working directory and an environment variable AZ_BATCH_CERTIFICATES_DIR is supplied to the task to query for this location. For certificates with visibility of 'remoteUser', a 'certs' directory is created in the user's home directory (e.g., /home/{user-name}/certs) and certificates are placed in that directory.
Warning: This property is deprecated and will be removed after February, 2024. Please use the [Azure KeyVault Extension](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/batch/batch-certificate-migration-guide) instead.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CreationTime As Nullable(Of DateTime)

Docs.summary: Gets the creation time of the pool.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CurrentDedicatedNodes As Nullable(Of Integer)

Docs.summary: Gets the number of dedicated compute nodes currently in the pool.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CurrentLowPriorityNodes As Nullable(Of Integer)

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Spot/low-priority compute nodes currently in the pool.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CurrentNodeCommunicationMode As Nullable(Of NodeCommunicationMode)

Docs.summary: Gets the current state of the pool communication mode.
Docs.remarks: Possible values include: 'Default', 'Classic', 'Simplified'

Docs.summary: Gets or sets this property describes how the pool nodes will be deployed - using Cloud Services or Virtual Machines.
Docs.remarks: Using CloudServiceConfiguration specifies that the nodes should be creating using Azure Cloud Services (PaaS), while VirtualMachineConfiguration uses Azure Virtual Machines (IaaS).

MemberSignature.Value: member this.DisplayName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the display name for the pool.
Docs.remarks: The display name need not be unique and can contain any Unicode characters up to a maximum length of 1024.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type of identity used for the Batch Pool.
Docs.remarks: The type of identity used for the Batch Pool.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property InterNodeCommunication As Nullable(Of InterNodeCommunicationState)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether the pool permits direct communication between nodes.
Docs.remarks: This imposes restrictions on which nodes can be assigned to the pool. Enabling this value can reduce the chance of the requested number of nodes to be allocated in the pool. If not specified, this value defaults to 'Disabled'. Possible values include: 'Enabled', 'Disabled'

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property LastModified As Nullable(Of DateTime)

Docs.summary: Gets the last modified time of the pool.
Docs.remarks: This is the last time at which the pool level data, such as the targetDedicatedNodes or autoScaleSettings, changed. It does not factor in node-level changes such as a compute node changing state.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property Metadata As IList(Of MetadataItem)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a list of name-value pairs associated with the pool as metadata.
Docs.remarks: The Batch service does not assign any meaning to metadata; it is solely for the use of user code.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MountConfiguration As IList(Of MountConfiguration)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a list of file systems to mount on each node in the pool.
Docs.remarks: This supports Azure Files, NFS, CIFS/SMB, and Blobfuse.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the network configuration for the pool.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ProvisioningState As Nullable(Of PoolProvisioningState)

Docs.summary: Gets the current state of the pool.
Docs.remarks: Possible values include: 'Succeeded', 'Deleting'

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ProvisioningStateTransitionTime As Nullable(Of DateTime)

Docs.summary: Gets the time at which the pool entered its current state.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ResizeOperationStatus As ResizeOperationStatus

Docs.summary: Gets contains details about the current or last completed resize operation.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets settings which configure the number of nodes in the pool.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a task specified to run on each compute node as it joins the pool.
Docs.remarks: In an PATCH (update) operation, this property can be set to an empty object to remove the start task from the pool.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property TargetNodeCommunicationMode As Nullable(Of NodeCommunicationMode)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the desired node communication mode for the pool.
Docs.remarks: If omitted, the default value is Default. Possible values include: 'Default', 'Classic', 'Simplified'

Docs.summary: Gets or sets how tasks are distributed across compute nodes in a pool.
Docs.remarks: If not specified, the default is spread.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property TaskSlotsPerNode As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.TaskSlotsPerNode : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of task slots that can be used to run concurrent tasks on a single compute node in the pool.
Docs.remarks: The default value is 1. The maximum value is the smaller of 4 times the number of cores of the vmSize of the pool or 256.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property UserAccounts As IList(Of UserAccount)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the list of user accounts to be created on each node in the pool.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

abstract member Validate : unit -> unit override this.Validate : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Validate the object.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.VmSize : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the size of virtual machines in the pool. All VMs in a pool are the same size.
Docs.remarks: For information about available sizes of virtual machines for Cloud Services pools (pools created with cloudServiceConfiguration), see Sizes for Cloud Services (https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/cloud-services-sizes-specs/). Batch supports all Cloud Services VM sizes except ExtraSmall. For information about available VM sizes for pools using images from the Virtual Machines Marketplace (pools created with virtualMachineConfiguration) see Sizes for Virtual Machines (Linux) (https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-linux-sizes/) or Sizes for Virtual Machines (Windows) (https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-windows-sizes/). Batch supports all Azure VM sizes except STANDARD_A0 and those with premium storage (STANDARD_GS, STANDARD_DS, and STANDARD_DSV2 series).
